target.name: Procedure
target.text: Ensure that your computer meets the systems requirement below:

target.name: Step
target.text: Ensure that your computer meets the systems requirement below:

target.name: Step
target.text: Power down the chassis and disconnect it from the power source.

target.name: Step
target.text: Remove the cover and set it aside.

target.name: Step
target.text: If you are installing more than one board, configure the two boards that are at the ends for H.100 bus termination. This is also a good time to configure the board(s) for PCI mode or PCI-X mode. This depends on the PCI slots in your chassis. Detailed instructions for both H.100 termination and PCI, PCI-X mode configurations are provided.

target.name: Step
target.text: Arrange the CG board(s) in adjacent PCI bus slots. Make sure each board's PCI bus connector is seated securely in a slot.

target.name: Step
target.text: Secure the end bracket on the board(s) to the chassis.

target.name: Step
target.text: If you have multiple CG boards, connect the H.100 bus cable to each of the CG boards.

target.name: Step
target.text: Replace the cover and connect the computer to its power source.

target.name: Step
target.text: Skip this step if your conference bridge only supports IP clients. If you have installed CG6565/64, now is the time to connect the mini RJ21 cable to the back of the CG6565/64 and the other end to the SEP panel to gain access to the 8 T1 or E1 trunks.
